title: Mastery and Reflection – Prepositions with the Ablative (Rest & Relationship)
goals: Demonstrate mastery of both Accusative and Ablative prepositions
Translate and chant phrases contrasting motion and rest
Preview adjective agreement for next week

steps.speak: Salve! Welcome to Week 15 Day 4 — our Peace Celebration Day!
Let’s chant together both preposition families.
Accusative – motion toward: ad, in, per, super, ante.
Ablative – rest and relationship: in, sub, cum, ē/ex, dē.
Now chant these pairs: in agrum (into the field) → in agrō (in the field).
per viam (through the road) → sub arbore (under the tree).
ad domum (to the house) → in domō (in the house).
Mini quiz: Which case shows motion toward?
Correct — the Accusative! And which case shows rest or place?
Right again — the Ablative! Bene factum!
Faith phrase: Cum Deō ambulāmus – We walk with God. When we walk rightly, we rest peacefully.
Virtue reflection: Peace is the calm that follows order — grammar and life both flow rightly when each part is in its place.
Optime! Next week we’ll revisit adjectives and learn how they agree with the nouns we’ve just used.
